snippet: The pro-business Free Democrats, also known as the F.D.P., have failed to even reach the 5 percent threshold for representation in five out of the last six state elections.
abstract: Germany begins the first of back-to-back weekends with key state polls, votes that will determine the future of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s weakened coalition partners, the pro-business group Free Democrats, and with it the sustainability of her government.
lead_paragraph: The pro-business Free Democrats, also known as the F.D.P., have failed to even reach the 5 percent threshold for representation in five out of the last six state elections.

headline.seo: German Party, Partner to Merkel, Faces Electoral Test
headline.main: Faltering German Party, a Coalition Partner to Merkel, Faces an Electoral Test
headline.print_headline: Faltering German Party, a Coalition Partner to Merkel, Faces an Electoral Test
